definition: cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
boat
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: Then we hand in hand together, with our solidarity of hands.
sentences.chinese: 那么我们携手同心，用我们同舟共济的双手。

sentences.english: No matter how the international landscape may evolve, China and the EU should always join hands and forge ahead like passengers in the same boat.
sentences.chinese: 不管国际风云如何变幻，中欧要同舟共济，携手并进。

sentences.english: The two countries should help each other to overcome difficulties, strengthen friendly cooperation and seek common development.
sentences.chinese: 两国应该同舟共济，共克时艰，友好合作，共谋发展。

sentences.english: Our comradeship and our brotherhood in war were unexampled .
sentences.chinese: 我们在战争年代同舟共济的兄弟情谊是史无前例的。

sentences.english: Teaming requires a "we're in this together" attitude.
sentences.chinese: 团队工作所需要的是“同舟共济”的态度。

sentences.english: China always stands side by side with ASEAN in times of difficulties and challenges.
sentences.chinese: 在困难和挑战面前，中国始终与东盟同舟共济。

definition: to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
of one mind (idiom)
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
to share joys and sorrows/sharing good times and hard times/same as 同甘共苦
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
to be of one mind/to work as one
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)
to work as one (idiom); united in a concerted effort/working hard together
unity of will is an impregnable stronghold (idiom)
to twist together to form a rope/(fig.) to unite/to work together
to be of one mind/to think or act alike
